original: WHEREAS, Bank of America and Supplier entered into the SLCMA in order to set forth the terms and conditions pursuant to which Supplier provides certain Software to Bank of America, WHEREAS, the parties desire to add to the SLCMA the Supplier Offer Placement System Software; NOW THEREFORE, in consideration of the promises and accords made herein, and the exchange of such good and valuable consideration, the receipt and sufficiency of which is hereby acknowledged, Bank of America and Supplier agree as follows:
ollama_generated:
WHEREAS, Supplier and Bank of America previously established the SLCMA to define the terms under which Software would be supplied by Supplier to Bank of America; recognizing that both parties may find it advantageous to expand upon this arrangement, THEY HEREBY AGREE, for valuable consideration mutually acknowledged, to amend the SLCMA as follows:

Bank of America and Supplier agree that the scope of the SLCMA shall be expanded to include the Supplier Offer Placement System Software. In so doing, Bank of America acknowledges its responsibility for proper integration and maintenance of the aforementioned software, while Supplier agrees to provide any necessary technical assistance and support as requested by Bank of America in good faith. This amendment serves to strengthen the collaborative relationship between the parties, reflecting their commitment to maximizing the value derived from the SLCMA.

original: (“Bank of America”) By:  /s/ Scott Grimes  By:  /s/ Chandra Torrence Name:  Scott Grimes  Name:  Chandra Torrence Title:  Chief Executive Officer  Title:  V.P., Sourcing Manager Date:  3/4/11  Date:  3/3/11 Source: CARDLYTICS, INC., S-1, 1/12/2018
ollama_generated:
("Bank of America") By: /s/ Scott Grimes On behalf of: Scott Grimes, in his capacity as the Chief Executive Officer

By: /s/ Chandra Torrence On behalf of: Chandra Torrence, in her capacity as the V.P., Sourcing Manager

Date: 3/4/11 Date: 3/3/11 Source: CARDLYTICS, INC., S-1, 1/12/2018

Rewritten to reflect that both parties are acting on behalf of their respective positions within the company, rather than as individuals. This subtle change emphasizes the official capacity in which they are entering into this agreement.
